sen.j: 正親町 雅子（おおぎまち なおこ、享和3年11月1日 (旧暦)（1803年12月14日） - 安政3年7月6日 (旧暦)（1856年8月6日））は、江戸時代後期の女院。
sen.e: Naoko OGIMACHI, who was born on December 14, 1803 and died on August 6, 1856, was Nyoin (woman bestowed with the title "in") in the late Edo period.
Naoko OGIMACHI (December 14, 1803 - August 6, 1856) was Nyoin (a woman bestowed with the title "in") in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルとの統一性を保つため、出生日と没日を()でまとめました。Womanの前にaを追加しました。
sen.e: Naoko OGIMACHI (December 14, 1803 - August 6, 1856) was Nyoin (a woman bestowed with the title "in") in the late Edo period.
Her father was Sanemitsu OGIMACHI.
Her father was Sanemitsu OGIMACHI.
Her father was Sanemitsu OGIMACHI.

sen.j: 母は四辻公定の娘千栄子。
sen.e: Her mother was Chieko, a daughter of Kintei YOTSUTSUJI..
Her mother was Chieko, a daughter of Kintei YOTSUTSUJI.
sen.cmt: 末尾のピリオドをひとつ削除しました。
sen.e: Her mother was Chieko, a daughter of Kintei YOTSUTSUJI.

sen.j: 子に孝明天皇のほか二皇子一皇女をもうけた。
sen.e: She gave birth to Emperor Komei and two other princes and a princess.
She had some children who were Emperor Komei, two other princes and one princess.
sen.cmt: gave birth to→had some children who wereに訂正しました。a princessをone princessに訂正しました。
sen.e: She had some children who were Emperor Komei, two other princes and one princess.

sen.j: 正親町家は洞院家の支流にあたる閑院流の名家。
sen.e: The OGIMACHI family was an important family of Kanin line, (one of the FUJIWARA clique) which was a branch of the TOIN family.
The OGIMACHI family was an important family on the Kanin line (one of the FUJIWARA clique) which was a branch of the TOIN family.
sen.cmt: of Kanin line→on the Kanin lineに訂正しました。
sen.e: The OGIMACHI family was an important family on the Kanin line (one of the FUJIWARA clique) which was a branch of the TOIN family.

sen.j: 1820年（文政3年）仁孝天皇の後宮に入って権典侍となり、翌1821年（文政4年）典侍となる。
sen.e: In 1820 she was accepted as Gon no naishi no suke (a temporary maid of honor) at the court of Emperor Ninko and was promoted to Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) in 1821.
In 1820, she was received at the court of Emperor Ninko and became "Gon no naishi no suke" (a temporary maid of honor); She was promoted to "Naishi no suke" (a court lady of the first rank) in 1821.
sen.cmt: accepted→received, as→becameに訂正しました。Andを削除し、; sheを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1820, she was received at the court of Emperor Ninko and became "Gon no naishi no suke" (a temporary maid of honor); She was promoted to "Naishi no suke" (a court lady of the first rank) in 1821.

sen.j: 1842年（天保13年）正五位下に叙され、翌1843年（天保14年）には藤大納言局と称した。
sen.e: In 1842 she received the title of Shougoika and next year she was named Toudainagon no tsubone.
In 1842, she was given the title "Shogoinoge"(Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade); She called herself "Todainagon no tsubone" the next year.
sen.cmt: received the title of→was given the titleに訂正し、ofを削除しました。"Shogoinoge"(Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)に訂正しました（定訳より）。andを削除し、;を追加しました。Was namedをcalled herselfに訂正しました。Next yearにtheを追加し、末尾に移動しました。
sen.e: In 1842, she was given the title "Shogoinoge"(Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade); She called herself "Todainagon no tsubone" the next year.

sen.j: 1850年（嘉永3年）准后となって院号宣下があって新待賢門院と号した。
sen.e: In 1850 she became Jugo and was named Shintaikenmonin, the title of which was permitted to use by the Imperial letter.
Since she was given the title "Jugo" in 1850, when the Imperial letter was issued to permit her to use the title "in," she called herself "Shintaikenmonin."
sen.cmt: 冒頭にsinceを追加し、院号宣下の訳を訂正しました。年を移動し、そのあとにwhenを追加しました。Was named→called herselfに訂正しました。
sen.e: Since she was given the title "Jugo" in 1850, when the Imperial letter was issued to permit her to use the title "in," she called herself "Shintaikenmonin."
